instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00045 5.10V on PPDCIN
threads.message:
No sign of liquid. 

came in with 5.10 V on PPDCIN

Had a 1.ohm short on PP3V3R3V0_AON. Found shorts on u4600 and u4700. Replaced them and now have 2.588kohm on PP3V3R3V0_AON. 

Replaced ISL and had PP3V3R3V0_AON, but now its gone and I dont have anything on PPDCIN anymore either. 


PPDCIN - 28.51 kohm.

The only original charger I have is an 87 W USB C, so I have been using a couple adapters from 60 w Magsafe 2. 


Thanks.

threads.title: 820-00045 5.10V on PPDCIN
threads.message: Use the 87 watt....sounds like bad ISL

threads.title: 820-00045 5.10V on PPDCIN
threads.message:
U7100 has firmware.
Did you solder new chip?

threads.title: 820-00045 5.10V on PPDCIN
threads.message:
Ok great, on the 87.

Yes I soldered u7100 from donor...

Thanks!

threads.title: 820-00045 5.10V on PPDCIN
threads.message:
So you don't get anything from charger now?
PP3V3R3V0_AON is 0V, as PPDCIN too?
Change U4700 again; maybe U4600 too.

threads.title: 820-00045 5.10V on PPDCIN
threads.message: Ok. Start with u4700, then move on to u4600?

threads.title: 820-00045 5.10V on PPDCIN
threads.message:
You may try to reflow them first.
Be sure to get good solders...

threads.title: 820-00045 5.10V on PPDCIN
threads.message:
Is there stencils available to reball these chips that you know of? U4600, U4650, ISL?

These chips came off of donor and I would feel more confident in their functionality if I could reball them

You mentioned that U7100 has firmware. Does that mean that I cannot buy individually, that is has to come off of a donor? 

Thank you!

threads.title: 820-00045 5.10V on PPDCIN
threads.message:
These small chips don't need reball usually.
Just be sure no big difference between pads and solder directly.

threads.title: 820-00045 5.10V on PPDCIN
threads.message:
Replaced U4700 and U4600, still 0 voltage on F4700. 

 PP3V3R3V0_AON - .005V / 8.05K Resistance. (seems high)

Feeling Lost, LOL.

threads.title: 820-00045 5.10V on PPDCIN
threads.message: Check continuity for the flex between MLB and USB-C port.
